IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. burnFinish((bool,uint64,uint128,bytes32,.details: Called after vault completes a token burn operation

deposit((bytes32,address,bytes32,bytes32.details: Constructs and sends a cross-chain message through the relay

params.data: The deposit information including token and amount details

depositWithFee((bytes32,address,bytes32,.details: Allows paying cross-chain fees in native tokens (e.g., ETH)

params.data: The deposit information including token and amount details

depositWithFeeRefund(address,(bytes32,ad.details: Allows specifying a refund address for unused cross-chain fees

params.data: The deposit information including token and amount details
params.refundReceiver: Address to receive any unused fee refunds

returns._0: A string indicating this is the vault cross-chain manager

initialize().details: Sets up the upgradeable contract with ownership and UUPS functionality

mintFinish((bool,uint64,uint128,bytes32,.details: Called after vault completes a token mint operation

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

receiveMessage((uint8,uint8,uint8,addres.details: Routes messages based on their type and forwards to vault

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setCCRelayOption(uint8).details: Allows the owner to set the cross-chain relay option0: LayerZeroV1, 1: LayerZeroV2

params._chainId: The chain ID where this contract is deployed

setCrossChainRelay(address).details: The relay handles the actual cross-chain message transmission

params._crossChainRelay: Address of the cross-chain relay contract

setCrossChainRelayV2(address).details: The relay handles the actual cross-chain message transmission

params._crossChainRelayV2: Address of the cross-chain relay contract

setLedgerCrossChainManager(uint256,addre.details: Required for routing messages to the ledger

params._ledgerCrossChainManager: Address of the ledger's cross-chain manager

setRelayStatus(address,bool).details: Allows the owner to enable or disable a relay

params._ccRelay: The address of the cross-chain relay
params._status: The new status of the relay (true for enabled, false for disabled)

setVault(address).details: The vault contract will be the only one allowed to initiate deposits

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Only callable by owner through proxy

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdraw((bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,uint12.details: Called after vault processes a withdrawal

burnFinish((bool,uint64,uint128,bytes32,.notice: Sends burn completion confirmation to the ledger

ccRelayOption().notice: Flag to indicate the version of the cross-chain relay

chainId().notice: Chain ID where this contract is deployed (vault chain)

crossChainRelay().notice: Interface to the cross-chain messaging relay

crossChainRelayV2().notice: Interface to the cross-chain messaging relay v2

deposit((bytes32,address,bytes32,bytes32.notice: Initiates a deposit to the ledger

depositWithFee((bytes32,address,bytes32,.notice: Initiates a deposit with native token fee payment

depositWithFeeRefund(address,(bytes32,ad.notice: Initiates a deposit with fee refund capability

enabledRelays(address).notice: Mapping of enabled cross-chain relay addresses

getDepositFee((bytes32,address,bytes32,b.notice: Fetches the deposit fee based on deposit data.

getRole().notice: Returns the role identifier for this contract

ledgerChainId().notice: Chain ID of the ledger chain

ledgerCrossChainManagers(uint256).notice: Maps chain IDs to their respective ledger cross-chain manager addresses

mintFinish((bool,uint64,uint128,bytes32,.notice: Sends mint completion confirmation to the ledger

receiveMessage((uint8,uint8,uint8,addres.notice: Handles incoming cross-chain messages from the relay

setChainId(uint256).notice: Sets the chain ID for this contract instance

setCrossChainRelay(address).notice: Sets the cross-chain relay contract address

setCrossChainRelayV2(address).notice: Sets the cross-chain relay contract address

setLedgerCrossChainManager(uint256,addre.notice: Sets the ledger chain ID and its cross-chain manager address

setRelayStatus(address,bool).notice: Sets the status of a cross-chain relay

setVault(address).notice: Links this contract to the vault

withdraw((bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,uint12.notice: Sends withdrawal confirmation back to the ledger
